snippet: Refining Canada’s petroleum-soaked oil sands produces petroleum coke, and the question of what to do with it has found at least one answer in Detroit, where a large coke pile covers an entire city block.
abstract: Detroit’s ever-growing black mountain of petroleum coke is the unloved, unwanted and long overlooked byproduct of Canada’s oil sands boom;  Koch Carbon, controlled by industrialists Charles and David Koch, owns and sells the high-sulfur, high-carbon waste, usually overseas, where it is burned as fuel.
lead_paragraph: Refining Canada’s petroleum-soaked oil sands produces petroleum coke, and the question of what to do with it has found at least one answer in Detroit, where a large coke pile covers an entire city block.

headline.seo: Mountain of Petroleum Coke From Oil Sands Rises in Detroit
headline.main: A Black Mound of Canadian Oil Waste Is Rising Over Detroit
headline.print_headline: From Canadian Oil, a Black Pile Rises in Detroit
